articles.title: The rise of Moltbook suggests viral AI prompts may be the next big security threat
articles.description: We don't need self-replicating AI models to have problems, just self-replicating prompts.
articles.content: On November 2, 1988, graduate student Robert Morris released a self-replicating program into the early Internet. Within 24 hours, the Morris worm had infected roughly 10 percent of all connected computers, crashing systems at Harvard, Stanford, NASA, and Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. The worm exploited security flaws in Unix systems that administrators knew existed but had not bothered to patch. Morris did not intend to cause damage. He wanted to measure the size of the Internet. But a
articles.author: Benj Edwards

articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Microbes could extract the metal needed for cleantech In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. Demand for
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: How much do VPNs cost?
articles.description: So you've decided you need a virtual private network to hide your browsing activity from your ISP, change your virtual location, stay safe on public Wi-Fi and enjoy all the other benefits . The inevitable next question is: "Should I pay for one? If so, how much?" All the best VPNs cost money, but it
articles.content: So you've decided you need a virtual private network to hide your browsing activity from your ISP, change your virtual location, stay safe on public Wi-Fi and enjoy all the other benefits . The inevitable next question is: "Should I pay for one? If so, how much?" All the best VPNs cost money, but it can be hard to tell an overpriced service apart from one that's priced according to its value. On this page, I'll share the costs for top VPN services, calculate the industry average and explain what
articles.author: Sam Chapman

articles.title: China bans all retractable car door handles, starting next year
articles.description: The pop-out door handle ban starts in 2027 for new cars, 2029 for existing models.
articles.content: Flush door handles have been quite the automotive design trend of late. Stylists like them because they don't add visual noise to the side of a car. And aerodynamicists like them because they make a vehicle more slippery through the air. When Tesla designed its Model S , it needed a car that was both desirable and as efficient as possible, so flush door handles were a no-brainer. Since then, as electric vehicles have proliferated, so too have flush door handles. But as of next year, China says n
articles.author: Jonathan M. Gitlin

articles.title: How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities
articles.description: A senior engineer's guide to architecting and extending Copilot's real-world applications. The post How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: Modern engineering work rarely lives in a single file. Real systems evolve across years of incrementally layered decisions—some good, some accidental. A single feature request (“Add tagging to notes,” “Refactor the validation layer,” “Support a new consumer on our API”) often touches controllers, domain models, repositories, migrations, tests, documentation, and deployment strategy. Copilot’s agentic capabilities don’t replace your judgment i
articles.author: Ari LiVigni

articles.title: LSP: IDE-Level Code Intelligence for Claude
articles.description: Claude gains the eyes of your IDE — diagnostics, navigation, type info, and more From: x.com/adocomplete There's a difference between reading code and understanding code. A text file shows you characters. Your IDE shows you meaning: where functions are defined, who calls them, what types flow throug
articles.content: Claude gains the eyes of your IDE — diagnostics, navigation, type info, and more From: x.com/adocomplete There's a difference between reading code and understanding code. A text file shows you characters. Your IDE shows you meaning: where functions are defined, who calls them, what types flow through them, where the errors hide. Until now, Claude read your code like text. Powerful, but limited. It could pattern-match and infer, but it couldn't truly see. With LSP integration, Claude gains the sa
articles.author: Rajesh Royal

At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. But earlier this
articles.content: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. But earlier this year, the mine’s owner started testing a new process that could eke out a bit more nickel. In a pair of shipping containers recently installed at the mine’s mill, a fermentation-derived broth develop
articles.author: Matt Blois

articles.title: What we’ve been getting wrong about AI’s truth crisis
articles.description: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here. What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch the
articles.content: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here . What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch the lie, and erodes societal trust in the process—is now here? A story I published last week pushed me over the edge. It also made me realize that the tools we were sold as a cure for this crisis are failing
articles.author: James O'Donnell

articles.title: Claude Code was down, forcing developers to take a long coffee break
articles.description: Anthropic's Claude AI models experienced a major outage today, impacting products like Claude Code. Developers were seeing a 500 error when trying to use Claude Code, and Anthropic said that it was seeing elevated error rates on its APIs "across all Claude models." Anthropic quickly identified the r
articles.content: Anthropic's Claude AI models experienced a major outage today, impacting products like Claude Code. Developers were seeing a 500 error when trying to use Claude Code, and Anthropic said that it was seeing elevated error rates on its APIs "across all Claude models." Anthropic quickly identified the root cause and implemented a fix within around 20 minutes, but developers that rely on the tool were left staring at their screens waiting for the service to come back online. Claude Opus 4.5 also expe
articles.author: Tom Warren

articles.title: What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built
articles.description: What languages are growing fastest, and why? What about the projects that people are interested in the most? Where are new developers cutting their teeth? Let’s take a look at Octoverse data to find out. The post What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built appeared first
articles.content: In 2025, software development crossed a quiet threshold. In our latest Octoverse report , we found that the fastest-growing languages, tools, and open source projects on GitHub are no longer about shipping more code. Instead, they’re about reducing friction in a world where AI is helping developers build more, faster. By looking at some of the areas of fastest growth over the past year, we can see how developers are adapting through: The programming languages that are growing most in AI-as
articles.author: Dylan Birtolo

articles.title: Fitbit founders launch Luffu, a way to integrate your family's health data
articles.description: Fitbit's founders have a new startup. Two years after leaving Google , James Park and Eric Friedman announced a new platform that shifts the focus from the individual to the family. They say the Luffu mobile app "uses AI quietly in the background" to collect and organize family health informatio
articles.content: Fitbit's founders have a new startup. Two years after leaving Google , James Park and Eric Friedman announced a new platform that shifts the focus from the individual to the family. They say the Luffu mobile app "uses AI quietly in the background" to collect and organize family health information. "At Fitbit, we focused on personal health — but after Fitbit, health for me became bigger than just thinking about myself," Park said in a press release. The app is particularly focused on the "CEO

These easily topped our list of the best wireless headphones . They are, in a word, fantastic. The headphones are packed wi
articles.content: Sony's wireless WH-1000XM6 headphones are on sale for $398 via Amazon . This is a record-low price, as it drops $62 from the price tag. The sale applies to all three colorways. These easily topped our list of the best wireless headphones . They are, in a word, fantastic. The headphones are packed with premium features , like advanced ANC. There are a whopping 12 ANC microphones throughout and a brand-new chip to power the feature. The end result? It successfully blocks background noise at medium

articles.title: French police raid X’s Paris office as UK investigation continues
articles.description: A raid on X's Paris office was carried out by the Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit on Tuesday with Europol and French police as part of an ongoing investigation that expanded in July to include Grok. As previously reported by Reuters, Elon Musk and former X CEO Linda Yaccarino were also summoned f
articles.content: A raid on X's Paris office was carried out by the Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit on Tuesday with Europol and French police as part of an ongoing investigation that expanded in July to include Grok. As previously reported by Reuters , Elon Musk and former X CEO Linda Yaccarino were also summoned for hearings in April. The investigation, which was initially launched last year , is looking into several allegations against X and Grok, including complicity in possession and distribution of child
articles.author: Stevie Bonifield

articles.title: Building Intelligent Retail Signage with BrightSign's NPU: A Deep Dive into Real-Time Gaze Detection
articles.description: Every Series 5 BrightSign player (except the XC line) ships with an onboard Neural Processing Unit. Most people don't know this. Even fewer have tried to use it. We think that should change. The NPU inside these players can run inference at up to 6 Trillion Operations Per Second (TOPS), enough to ea
articles.content: Every Series 5 BrightSign player (except the XC line) ships with an onboard Neural Processing Unit. Most people don't know this. Even fewer have tried to use it. We think that should change. The NPU inside these players can run inference at up to 6 Trillion Operations Per Second (TOPS), enough to easily process real time computer vision workloads. To demonstrate what's possible, we built a showcase application: a smart retail signage system that detects when people are looking at the display, ad
articles.author: Luca Herlein

articles.title: Senior staff departing OpenAI as firm prioritizes ChatGPT development
articles.description: Resources are redirected from long-term research toward improving the flagship chatbot.
articles.content: OpenAI is prioritizing the advancement of ChatGPT over more long-term research, prompting the departure of senior staff as the $500 billion company adapts to stiff competition from rivals such as Google and Anthropic. The San Francisco-based start-up has reallocated resources for experimental work in favor of advances to the large language models that power its flagship chatbot, according to 10 current and former employees. Among those to leave OpenAI in recent months over the strategic shift ar
articles.author: Cristina Criddle, Financial Times

articles.content: Apple currently sells MacBooks equipped with its own M-series processors in a wide range of sizes and price points, all of which run the company’s newest operating system, macOS 26 . Purchasing a new MacBook can be complicated if you’re trying to figure out what specs you need, but finding a deal on a relatively speedy model is surprisingly easy, especially since Apple increased the starting RAM on several models in late 2024 and hasn’t stopped. These days, it’s not uncommon to see various MacBo

articles.title: Unable to tame hydrogen leaks, NASA delays launch of Artemis II until March
articles.description: NASA spent most of Monday trying to overcome hydrogen leaks on the Artemis II rocket.
articles.content: The launch of NASA's Artemis II mission, the first flight of astronauts to the Moon in more than 53 years, will have to wait another month after a fueling test Monday uncovered hydrogen leaks in the connection between the rocket and its launch platform at Kennedy Space Center in Florida. "Engineers pushed through several challenges during the two-day test and met many of the planned objectives," NASA said in a statement following the conclusion of the mock countdown, or Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR)
articles.author: Stephen Clark

articles.title: The Switch is Nintendo’s best-selling console — and its most transformative
articles.description: Nintendo has had plenty of highs over its few decades in the video game industry. Popularizing home consoles with the NES, introducing new audiences to games through the Wii's motion controls, and the touchscreen Trojan horse that was the Nintendo DS, to name a few. But often these successes were fo
articles.content: Nintendo has had plenty of highs over its few decades in the video game industry. Popularizing home consoles with the NES, introducing new audiences to games through the Wii's motion controls, and the touchscreen Trojan horse that was the Nintendo DS , to name a few. But often these successes were followed by missteps; the Wii sold 100 million units, while its follow-up, the Wii U, couldn't even manage a quarter of that. But that precarity looks to change. The Switch is now Nintendo's best-selli
articles.author: Andrew Webster
